episode_summary: This episode covers a range of topics including the massive amount of clothing waste in Ghana, Ford's patent for a self-repossessing car, the healthiest way to eat broccoli, and a hospital's accidental text message about terminal illness. The hosts discuss the implications of fast fashion, innovative car technologies, the nutritional benefits of broccoli, and the chaos caused by a mistaken text message.

facts.fact: 15 million clothing items are dumped in Ghana every week.
Ford has just got a patent for a car which can repossess itself if the owner falls behind with payments.
The healthiest way to eat broccoli is to stir fry it after chopping it into two millimeter pieces and leaving it to stand for an hour and a half.
Last year on December 23rd, a hospital in Doncaster accidentally sent a text message to thousands of its patients informing them that they had an aggressive terminal disease.
